stimulus:
In this study, you will read text scenarios and make slider judgments about the situations which they describe. Here is an image of an example trial.


In the upcoming trials, please read the descriptions and give your answer by clicking on the slider. Please read each scenario description carefully, but we are interested in your intuitive judgment so no need to second-guess yourself.

You must make a slider judgment in each trial. You will not receive any feedback.


When you are ready to begin, press the start button.

Amy's boyfriend Jake wants to talk about their date this weekend, but Amy is tired:
Jake: "Hey, can we talk about this weekend?"
Amy: "I'm utterly exhausted right now. Would it be okay if we talk about it tomorrow instead?"

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is Amy?

Sophie and her friend, Mia, attend a classical music recital.
Mia: "The performance was so elegant. I loved how the orchestra played together."
Sophie: "I found it boring. Classical music isn't quite my style."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the recital for Sophie?

A tour guide shares historical facts about an ancient castle.
Visitor: "Your knowledge of the history here is impressive. I've learned so much today."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is the visitor?

Lucy notices her dog has been unusually lethargic and hasn't eaten much.
Lucy: "I'm deeply concerned about Max. He hasn't been himself lately. I think we should take him to the vet."

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Lucy?

Sarah's sister mentions she's been struggling to pay her bills.
Sarah: "I'm totally concerned about how you've been managing financially. Have you thought about talking to a financial advisor?"

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Sarah?

David observes that his colleague has been distant.
David: "I've noticed you haven't been as chatty as usual. I'm concerned if everything is okay at home."

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is David?

David shows his friend Emma a model airplane he built from scratch.
Emma: "Wow, David! The level of detail on this is utterly impressive."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressive is Emma?

David shows his friend Emma a model airplane he built from scratch.
Emma: "Wow, David! The level of detail on this is impressive."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is Emma?

Emma asks her grandmother for guidance on how to cook a traditional family dish.
Emma: "Thanks for explaining the steps so clearly, Grandma. You've been deeply helpful."

On a scale from "minimally helpful" to "maximally helpful", how helpful did Emma find her Grandma's help?

During a group project, Alex helps Jessica by clarifying some confusing instructions.
Jessica: "I appreciate you taking the time to explain that. You've been helpful."

On a scale from "minimally helpful" to "maximally helpful", how helpful did Jessica find Alex's help?

John attends a lecture on a topic that doesn't interest him at all. He tells his classmate afterwards:
John: "I tried to stay focused, but the lecture was totally boring. The professor's monotone voice didn't help either."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the lecture for John?

Anna explains why she decided to postpone her vacation to her friend Dan.
Anna: "I think I need to save more money before I can go."
Dan: "That's totally understandable; budgeting is important."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is Anna's reason for Dan?

Mia's sister asks her to babysit her kids for an evening.
Sister: "Could you watch the kids for a few hours tonight?"
Mia: "I wish I could, but I'm exhausted after chasing my own little ones all day. Can we plan for another time?"

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is Mia?

Sophie and her friend, Mia, attend a classical music recital.
Mia: "The performance was so elegant. I loved how the orchestra played together."
Sophie: "I found it really boring. Classical music isn't quite my style."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the recital for Sophie?

Sophia watches her younger sibling perform a difficult gymnastics routine.
Sophia: "That was impressive. I can't believe how much you've improved!"

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is Sophia?

Mia's sister asks her to babysit her kids for an evening.
Sister: "Could you watch the kids for a few hours tonight?"
Mia: "I wish I could, but I'm rather exhausted after chasing my own little ones all day. Can we plan for another time?"

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is Mia?

At a science fair, Sarah explains her project on renewable energy to a judge.
Judge: "Your understanding of the subject is impressive for someone your age."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is the judge?

Rachel reflects on the lecture with a friend afterward:
Friend: "How was the astrophysics lecture? I heard the professor is supposed to be brilliant."
Rachel: "The topic is undoubtedly fascinating, but I found the lecture boring. Without a stronger background in the subject, it was difficult to stay engaged."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the lecture for Rachel?

David explains to his manager why he didn't complete a presentation on time.
David: "I didn't get the data I needed from the supplier until this morning, so I couldn't finish the slides."
Manager: "That's deeply understandable. Let me know if there's anything I can do to help you stay on track."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is David's reason for his manager?

Sam apologizes to his coworker, Rachel, for missing a call during a meeting.
Sam: "I didn't see your call; I was in a meeting."
Rachel: "That's understandable; we often have back-to-back meetings."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is Sam's reason for Rachel?

Liam asks his neighbor to help him carry a heavy table into his house.
Liam: "I couldn't have done it without you. You've been helpful."

On a scale from "minimally helpful" to "maximally helpful", how helpful did Liam find his neighbor's help?

David explains to his manager why he didn't complete a presentation on time.
David: "I didn't get the data I needed from the supplier until this morning, so I couldn't finish the slides."
Manager: "That's understandable. Let me know if there's anything I can do to help you stay on track."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is David's reason for his manager?

A tour guide shares historical facts about an ancient castle.
Visitor: "Your knowledge of the history here is rather impressive. I've learned so much today."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressed is the visitor?

Anna notices her friend, Jake, coughing frequently during their hike.
Anna: "You've been coughing a lot today. I'm really concerned that you might be coming down with something. Have you seen a doctor?"

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Anna?

Megan has been searching for a gift for her grandmother, who recently moved into assisted living. After weeks of fruitless searching, a sales assistant helps Megan track down the perfect item - a vintage music box her grandmother had as a child.
Megan: "I can't thank you enough. I've been looking for something like this for so long. You've been helpful."

On a scale from "minimally helpful" to "maximally helpful", how helpful did Megan find the sales assistant's help?

Sarah shares why she got upset during a group discussion.
Sarah: "I got defensive because the topic hit close to home for me."
Friend: "That's fairly understandable. It's hard to stay calm when it's something so personal."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is Sarah 's reason for her friend?

Jake attends a mandatory corporate training session.
Coworker: "I thought the trainer was engaging and kept it fun."
Jake: "I don't know. I thought it was boring. Too much theory, not enough practical examples."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the training session for Jake?

Chris's friend Emma asks if you want to join her on a weekend trip:
Emma: "We're planning a spontaneous road trip this weekend. Want to join?"
Chris: "That sounds amazing, but I'm exhausted from traveling all week. I need to recharge before diving into anything else."

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is Chris?

Lucy notices her dog has been unusually lethargic and hasn't eaten much.
Lucy: "I'm concerned about Max. He hasn't been himself lately. I think we should take him to the vet."

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Lucy?

Ben's cousin Amy asks him if he's coming to their monthly family gathering:
Amy: "Are you coming to the family dinner this evening?"
Ben: "I'd love to, but I'm really exhausted from everything that happend at work this week. I'll catch up with everyone next time."

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is Ben?

David goes to a museum with his partner.
Partner: "The ancient artifacts were so cool to see!"
David: "I found it boring. I prefer exhibits with more interactive displays."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the musuem for David?

David shows his friend Emma a model airplane he built from scratch.
Emma: "Wow, David! The level of detail on this is impressive."

On a scale from "minimally impressive" to "maximally impressive", how impressive is Emma?

David watches a professional surfer ride a massive wave.
David: "That was awe-inspiring. The skill and bravery it takes to ride a wave like that is unbelievable."

On a scale from "minimally awe-inspiring" to "maximally awe-inspiring", how awe-inspired is David?

Lisa meets with her child's teacher to discuss declining grades.
Lisa: "I noticed my son's grades have dropped significantly, and I'm fairly concerned about how this might affect his future."

On a scale from "minimally concerned" to "maximally concerned", how concerned is Lisa?

A traveler, Sam, asks an airport staff member where to find a particular gate.
Sam: "Thanks for pointing me in the right direction. You've been helpful."

On a scale from "minimally helpful" to "maximally helpful", how helpful did Sam find the staff's help?

During a safari in Africa, Lily spots a herd of elephants in the wild.
Lily: "This is awe-inspiring! Seeing these majestic animals in their natural habitat is incredible."

On a scale from "minimally awe-inspiring" to "maximally awe-inspiring", how awe-inspired is Lily?

John attends a lecture on a topic that doesn't interest him at all. He tells his classmate afterwards:
John: "I tried to stay focused, but the lecture was boring. The professor's monotone voice didn't help either."

On a scale from "minimally boring" to "maximally boring", how boring was the lecture for John?

Anna tells her professor that she needs a few extra days to complete an assignment due to family obligations.
Anna: "I'm very sorry, but could I have an extension on the assignment? I had a family emergency."
Professor: "That's utterly understandable, Anna. Take the extra time you need."

On a scale from "minimally understandable" to "maximally understandable", how understandable is Anna's reason for her professor?

Sarah is interning at a company, and her boss, Mr. Thompson asks to stay to finish up her report.
Mr. Thompson: Can you stay late today to help finish up the report?
Sarah: "I'm feeling a little exhausted after the back-to-back meetings today, so I'm not sure I'd be at my best. Would it be alright if I leave come in early tomorrow to finish it up?"

On a scale from "minimally exhausted" to "maximally exhausted", how exhausted is Sarah?

Sophie: "The landscape here is totally awe-inspiring. I feel so small in comparison to these towering peaks."

On a scale from "minimally awe-inspiring" to "maximally awe-inspiring", how awe-inspired is Sophie?
